Maserati Ghibli 0-60 times

Autotk.com offers accurate information on Maserati Ghibli 0-60 times and quarter mile from trusted sources. You may also keep track of how 0-60 times of Maserati Ghibli changed across years and check out the model’s competitors with the same acceleration performance.

Our mission is to present an easy-to-read and comprehensive information on Maserati Ghibli 0-60 mph and quarter mile for the devoted geeks, as it is an essential indicator of the vehicle power.

Attenzione Tifosi, there is still hope! In the northern Italian city of Modena, the traditional brand Maserati is experiencing its second spring, is more successful than ever before. And this has a very simple reason: Finally, the Italians build good cars. How good is our first test of the new Ghibli, a sedan from the hit of the BMW 5 Series. And indeed, they have clearly looked at the Bavarians very closely when they created the Ghibli. Less in design, here chief designer Lorenzo Ramaciotti has succeeded in his own design, albeit without the genius of earlier Pininfarina designs. But in the format they have taken the 5er as an example, the space offer resembles rather the intimate cuddiness of the BMW than the casual width of a Mercedes E-Class. Fits perfectly to the ambience, here at Maserati they have changed a lot, a little worse and a lot better than the German premium colleagues.

And, although Maserati belongs to Fiat Chrysler, an American-style conglomerate, they are bound to their Italian roots in Modena. So they do not like to talk about assistance systems (the Ghibli has hardly any) - and much rather that the fabric drapes of the seat are not simply cloth covers, but together with the Nobel gentlemen's outfit Ermenegildo Zegna developed silk fabrics. Maserati is much more important however: the Maserati is properly processed well, even on bad slopes rattles or rapples nothing. However, it is no wonder that Maserati has built a new factory for this limousine, which works with state-of-the-art production techniques. Only the engine does not come from there: It is manufactured at the Nobel-sister Ferrari in Maranello. A little jewel, this double-charged six-cylinder. Throaty-smoky sound and power in every living situation - rarely was a car in this class so sportily motorized. The only downside is the hefty test consumption of 13.5 liters per 100 kilometers, the finest Super plus, of course. Maserati Ghibli runs from 0 to 60 in 5.00 seconds.

To the hot engine synonymous the suspension adjustment. Tough, but not too hard - so Maserati shows that they can now also skillfully matched adaptive chassis. In addition, the fun-trimmed all-wheel drive, which even allows drifts. We know it only from Porsche. We at Autotk have rarely had so much fun in a business sedan. And so the good news remains in the end: love has remained, suffering has an end.
